intro: Fernseea bocainensis, commonly known as the Bocainense fern, is a species of fern native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Fernseea bocainensis plays a role in maintaining biodiversity in its native ecosystem.
